github_projects.name: NFL_Big_Data_Bowl_2026
github_projects.description: Deep learning solution for predicting NFL player trajectories from tracking data. Kaggle Bronze Medal (Top 8% of 1,134 teams) in NFL Big Data Bowl 2026 competition. Explored 15+ architectures across 847+ experiments with systematic hyperparameter optimization.
notable_features: Kaggle Bronze Medal - Top 8% of 1,134 teams
Best ensemble: 0.540 Public LB (3-model: ST Transformer + CNN + GRU)
Best single model: 6-Layer ST Transformer (0.547 Public LB)
Novel geometric attention with Voronoi tessellation and spatial distance modulation
Key discovery: Architecture diversity in ensembles outperforms model stacking
Frozen encoder fine-tuning for transfer learning
13 comprehensive Jupyter notebooks documenting all experiments

github_projects.name: RSNA_Intracranial_Aneurysm_Detection
github_projects.description: Comprehensive 3D deep learning solution for detecting and localizing intracranial aneurysms from CT angiography scans. First Kaggle competition with systematic exploration of 21 architectures across 5-fold cross-validation.
notable_features: Key discovery: Smaller models outperform larger ones on limited medical data (r=-0.42, p<0.01)
4 GPUs running simultaneously (2× RTX 5090, RTX 3090 Ti, RTX 3090)
Multi-label classification (14 classes: 13 anatomical locations + presence flag)
Handles severe class imbalance (1.2% to 42.8% across classes)
6 comprehensive Jupyter notebooks documenting all experiments

github_projects.name: Apollo_Healthcare_Connect
github_projects.description: A Production-Grade Multi-Modal Deep Learning Medical Triage System developed as Western Governors University Data Science Capstone Project
notable_features: Real-time inference with sub-second response times
Conservative routing protocols for patient safety
Multi-modal AI combining text and image analysis

github_projects.name: missing-persons-outlier-detection
github_projects.description: Statistical anomaly detection system analyzing 41,200 missing persons and unidentified bodies cases across 101 years to identify trafficking corridors, cartel activity, and organized crime patterns
notable_features: Analyzed 41,200 cases over 101 years (9,204 county-decade combinations)
Identified I-35 corridor trafficking pattern (+10.80 cases/year acceleration)
Discovered Texas border worsening (+81%) while CA/AZ improved
Pima County, AZ: 44.75 standard deviations above baseline (529 bodies)
Validated against known serial killers (Ridgway: 4.38σ, Gacy: 1.34σ)
Law enforcement analytics for trafficking and organized crime detection

github_projects.name: Kaggle_House_Prices_Advanced_Regression
github_projects.description: Comprehensive machine learning solution for Kaggle House Prices competition featuring advanced feature engineering, ensemble methods, and modern AutoML techniques
notable_features: 20+ model ensemble (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost, Ridge, Lasso, ElasticNet)
Multi-level stacking with optimized weighted blending
Complete ML pipeline: EDA → Feature Engineering → Model Training → Ensemble
5 comprehensive Jupyter notebooks documenting full workflow
Cross-validation with inverse RMSE weighting strategy

github_projects.name: NFL_Rookie_WR_1K_Analysis
github_projects.description: Advanced Machine Learning Analysis with Feature Optimization and Temporal Validation to predict which NFL rookie wide receivers will achieve 1000+ yard receiving seasons
notable_features: 90.9% ROC AUC on future data validation

github_projects.name: amazon_optimization
github_projects.description: Linear Programming solution to optimize Amazon's multi-tier cargo distribution network, minimizing transportation costs while satisfying constraints
notable_features: Multi-tier network optimization (2 hubs, 3 focus cities, 65 distribution centers)
Academic project for Western Governors University D605 Advanced Analytics
Complete optimization pipeline with data processing
